primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God bypasses established power structures to initiate a new era of history through an unconventional messenger.

tekstueel_bewijs: The word of God came unto John
God marches among us in weird ways
God speaks in the language of events
Momentous anticipations of incredible things about to happen
they do not come by human reckoning but by God's will
New eras, new ages appear among men
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as a spectator of God's history who must decide whether to 'midwife' the future or resist it.

helper.identificatie: John the Baptist / The 'Strange' People (Youth, Outcasts)
tekstueel_bewijs: God... puts the shout of his approach upon strange lips
John was... a spokesman for the everlasting God
helper.rol_van_god: God is the primary Subject; John is the instrumental Helper/Messenger.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (The Word 'coming' to the subject).

tekstueel_bewijs: shams and pretenses of their elders
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opposition is not just personal bad habits but the entire structure of world empires and religious institutions that claim permanence.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response: preparing the way for the divine invasion.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Straight paths / Prepared highways for God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon explicitly states that humans cannot bring the new era to pass (Primary), but must prepare the road (Secondary).

voorbeelden_god_subject: The word of God came unto John
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We shall need to bring forth better fruits
We can open up the highways

voorbeelden: We shall need to bring forth better fruits
There must be some stable institutions
They do not want to be disturbed
We cannot bring to pass the things God will have happen
We can open up the highways

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Will'—the desire for comfort versus the passion for God's new future.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Established Power) to ~S2 (The Wilderness/John) to S1 (The coming Word).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God bypasses S2 to establish S1 through the 'crank' in the wilderness.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the sermon emphasizes the 'purple of royalty' and 'invariably obeyed commands' as a formidable but ultimately passing reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While there are ethical imperatives at the end, the engine of the sermon is the sovereign, unpredictable action of God in history. God is the Subject of the primary movement.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: they can, by God's grace and their own effort, serve the things of God

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: New eras... do not come by human reckoning but by God's will.
The word of God came unto John... God bypasses the correct people.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: John the Baptist and the 'strange youth' are used as models of openness to God.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon mostly avoids pure exemplarism by framing these figures as 'helpers' to God's primary action rather than heroes to be imitated by human will alone.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: A sense of awe and a call to stop resisting the inevitable movement of God.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is framed as God's invasion of a stagnant world.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from God's sovereign action in history to the hearer's responsibility to 'prepare the way' is logically integrated.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God's grace' and 'their own effort' in the section on institutions.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The 'divine invasion' and the breaking of the 'incurable disease' of power.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Word 'comes' to John, granting him the competence to speak.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is seen as institutional blindness and the 'arrogance' of power.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the 'New Era'. The hearer is correctly placed as a receiver/responder.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might identify too much with the 'nice people' being criticized.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: The 'Receiver' of the Word in the wilderness.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that we are all 'wilderness' people until the Word comes.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Devoir (Must) at the very end.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Clarify that God not only asks us to 'level the mountains' but provides the 'bulldozer' of the Spirit.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly identified as the 'purple of royalty' and 'stifling political circles'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's invasion) correctly precedes Ethics (Preparing the way).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful theocentric sermon that uses historical narrative to ground the sovereign action of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the imagery of 'camel's hair', semiotics reveals that John is merely a 'Helper' actant for the 'Word' Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the historical Tiberius; semiotics focuses on Tiberius as the 'Opponent' to the 'New Era'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'strange youth' and 'John' occupy the same actantial slot (Helper), validating the preacher's contemporary application.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids moralism by making the 'change' a result of God's will rather than human repentance, though it calls for repentance as a response.
